explanation: Correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 says a pointer shall point to a const-qualified type whenever possible. In this function the variable de is only read (de->d_name is inspected and used in snprintf/stat calls) and never used to modify the dirent object, so it can and should be declared const struct dirent *de. Assigning the result of readdir (which returns struct dirent *) to a pointer-to-const is allowed (you are adding const qualification). Therefore the code as written fails to apply const where possible and violates Rule 8.13. (Note: when fixing, be aware of any other MISRA rules about passing pointers through variadic functions; that is a separate concern.)
